question: Echoes are heard when we shout in an empty hall. But when the hall is full of people no echoes are heard why?
option1: Echoes are subdued in the noise of people
option2: Soft clothes of people absorb sound instead of reflecting it
option3: Destructive interference of sound takes place
explanation: Echoes are heard when we shout in an empty hall. But when the hall is full of people no echoes are heard because excessive reverberations take place.
